subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing Private Methods
msgSnippet: ... There s two, for Java at least: the second is that making objects Serializable expands the interface of that object beyond its public methods. Bill de
messageBody:
Eric Armstrong wrote:

> Documenting *only* interfaces would make it possible to define the
> "published
> subset" of public APIs.
>
> There is one downside, however.


There's two, for Java at least: the second is that making objects
Serializable expands the interface of that object beyond its public
methods.

Bill de hÓra
